random_forest module

class random_forest.RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, min_samples_split=2, max_depth=2)[source]

Bases: object

Random Forest Regressor

fit(X, y)[source]

Trains the Random Forest on the given dataset.

This method creates individual decision trees, each trained on a bootstrap sample of the original dataset, and stores them in the ‘trees’ list.

Parameters: - X: The features of the training dataset. - y: The target values of the training dataset.

predict(X)[source]

Predicts target values for the given dataset using the trained Random Forest.

The prediction for each instance is the average prediction of all the trees.

Parameters: - X: The features of the dataset for which to make predictions.

Returns: - The average predictions of all trees.

random_forest.plot_combined_regression_with_random_forest(train_data, test_data, coefficients, m, q, tree_regressor, forest_regressor)[source]

Plots the results of linear, polynomial, decision tree, and random forest regressions on the training and test data.
